alert.note: Alert for South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 11 at 11:05PM MDT until June 12 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE CONDITIONS EXPECTED MONDAY FOR SOUTHWEST NEW MEXICO... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT MONDAY FOR WARM, DRY, AND BREEZY CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 111 AND 112... * WIND...West to southwest around 20 mph with gusts to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...7 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands
